snippet: “Chinese Gardens: Pavilions, Studios, Retreats,” a new exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, features 80 paintings and objects that evoke the garden’s role across more than 1,000 years of Chinese culture.
abstract: Holland Cotter reviews exhibit Chinese Gardens: Pavilions, Studios, Retreats, featuring garden-themed paintings and objects, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
lead_paragraph: “Chinese Gardens: Pavilions, Studios, Retreats,” a new exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, features 80 paintings and objects that evoke the garden’s role across more than 1,000 years of Chinese culture.

headline.seo: ‘Chinese Gardens,’ at the Metropolitan Museum of Art
headline.main: Ancient Havens of Reflection and Renewal
headline.print_headline: Ancient Havens of Reflection and Renewal
